content.description:
Just to the right of Cover Girl and down, is a large angling jug.  Layback up this for a couple of moves to get the blood going.  Mantel and dance your way up for the mental warmup for the other problems, trending slightly left.  Worth doing. 

 A tiered landing...but it's done after the mantel.
content.location: Just to the right of Cover Girl and down, is a large angling jug.

content.description: Start standing from the huge left facing jug in the center of the face.  Trend up and left to get high feet and a huge undercling/sidepull.  Make a huge reach to a good flake.  More holds will appear up and left. Trend right at the top where necessary to do so.

Start on a rail from a sit, slap up and left to gorgeous slopers, and find a sequence to trend right to reach the perfect pinch with your left hand.  

 Make a long move to a good edge, or sidepull knob.  Find a way to climb the rightside of the arete, with pinches for the left hand and crimps for the right.

 The tree gets close to your back as you go up, because of the overhang.  It's still rock climbing, but the climbing is easy in the no-fall territory.
content.location: From the bottom of the arete on the south east side of the boulder.

content.description: Start matched with your hands on a small square hold, or with a left hand on a sloping pinch.  Go up left to the good sidepull.  Get high feet to hit the good undercling, and trend right to follow the good holds, just staying above the landing zone.

content.location: On the east face.  There is a prominent fin of rock for a foot.  A low landhand sloper sidepull, and a right hand sidepull square.  Make a move up and left to the prominent pinch, and topout as for Crossbones.

content.description: Perhaps the best of the Rappel Rock area, the rock on this one is excellent.  The namesake problem is not to be missed.
